title: Paraglider drowns in ocean on North Carolina coast
title_page: Paraglider drowns in ocean on North Carolina coast
maintext:
KILL DEVIL HILLS, N.C. (AP) — A paraglider has drowned after he crashed into the Atlantic Ocean off the North Carolina coast, officials said Tuesday.
Police officers in Kill Devil Hills responded to a call just before 7 p.m. Tuesday regarding a report about a paragilder, a news release from the town said.
According to the release, William B. Koebornick, 52, landed in the ocean about 50 yards (45 meters) offshore and near the Avalon Pier. An eyewitness and police officers attempted to rescue the man, but officials said the weight of the paraglider’s motor, the harness entanglement and the wave action pulled the man underwater.
There were 2-to-4-foot (0.6-to-1,2-meter) seas and the water temperature was approximately 54 degrees as the time of the accident, the news release said.
